column6: There are three main types of diabetes: type 1, type 2, and gestational diabetes (diabetes while pregnant).
column7: Type 1 diabetes is thought to be caused by an autoimmune reaction (the body attacks itself by mistake). This reaction stops your body from making insulin. Approximately 5-10% of the people who have diabetes have type 1. Type 1 diabetes can be diagnosed at any age, and symptoms often develop quickly. If you have type 1 diabetes, you�ll need to take insulin every day to survive. Currently, no one knows how to prevent type 1 diabetes.
